fields.content:
= SandBox = 

Welcome to the Sandbox. This page allows you to carry out experiments, so feel free to do whatever you want here!

To edit, click the **edit link** at the bottom of this page. Then, make your changes in the provided text box, and click the //Save Page// button when finished. 

Be sure to check out the [[FormattingGuide|formatting guide]] which will explain what syntax you can use on this wiki.

= Formatting Guide = This wiki uses the **[[http://www.wikicreole.org/wiki/Creole1.0|Creole 1.0 syntax]]** with a few enhancements. Once you have read through this, test your formatting skills in the [[SandBox]]! ==== Basics ==== ===== Text Formatting ===== <>Add creoleparser additions, like superscript<> | |=Type this |=To get this: | | **Bold** | {{{**Your Text**}}} | **Your Text** | | **Italic** | {{{//Your Text//}}} | //Your Text// | | **Monospace** | {{{##Your Text##}}} | ##Your Text## | | **No Wiki** | {{{{{{**Your** //Text//}}}}}} | {{{**Your** //Text//}}} | | **Line Break** | {{{Your\\Text}}} | Your\\Text | | **Superscript** | {{{^^Your^^ Text}}} | ^^Your^^ Text | | **Subscript** | {{{,,Your,, Text}}} | ,,Your,, Text | **Tip**: Anything between {{{{{{}}} and {{{}}}}}} is not formatted as wiki text. ===== Links ===== Text surrounded with {{{[[}}} and {{{]]}}} are automatically converted into wiki links (any spaces are replaced with underscores in the wiki url). Text formatting (eg. bold and italic) and //even images// can appear inside links. Free standing links are automatically converted into real links. | **Wiki Link** | {{{[[SandBox]]}}} | [[SandBox]] | | **Link Text** | {{{[[SandBox|Visit the **sandbox**!]]}}} | [[SandBox|Visit the **sandbox**!]] | | **URL** | {{{[[http://www.wikicreole.org/]]}}} | [[http://www.wikicreole.org/]] | | **Auto-convert** | {{{http://www.wikicreole.org/}}} | http://www.wikicreole.org/ | | **URL Link Text** | {{{[[http://www.wikicreole.org/|Visit WikiCreole]]}}} | [[http://www.wikicreole.org/|Visit WikiCreole]] | ===== Headers ===== Use between **one** (largest header) and **six** (smallest header) equal signs, {{{=}}} on both sides of a text to render it as a header. Text formatting and links can appear in headers. For example: | **Largest header** | {{{=Your Text=}}} | <>

Your Text

<> | | **Medium header** | {{{===Your Text===}}} | <>

Your Text

<> | | **Smallest header** | {{{======Your Text======}}} | <>
Your Text
<> | | **Formatted header** | {{{=====**Your** //Text//=====}}} | <>
Your Text
<> | **Tip**: A header that appears at the top of a wiki document will be parsed as the page title. ===== Lists ===== To create unordered (bulleted) lists, append {{{*}}} to the front of your list elements; append {{{#}}} for ordered (numbered) lists. To create nested elements in the list (indenting the list), just increase the list syntax character (eg. {{{**}}} and {{{##}}}). You can also mix the two types of lists too! | **Unordered List** | {{{* Bullet List}}}\\{{{* Second Item}}}\\{{{** Sub Item}}} | <>
  • Bullet List
  • Second Item
    • Sub Item
<> | | **Ordered List** | {{{# Numbered List}}}\\{{{# Second Item}}}\\{{{## Sub Item}}} | <>
  1. Numbered List
  2. Second Item
    1. Sub Item
<> | | **Mixed List** | {{{* Numbered List}}}\\{{{* Second Item}}}\\{{{## Numbered Item}}}\\{{{## Sub Item}}} | <>
  • Bullet List
  • Second Item
    1. Numbered List
    2. Sub Item
<> | ==== Intermediate ==== ===== Images ===== <>TODO: Talk about how to host/add images<> | **Image** | {{{{{http://www.gstatic.com/m/images/}}}\\{{{logo_large_noshade.gif}}}}} | {{http://www.gstatic.com/m/images/logo_large_noshade.gif}} | | **With Alt. Text** | {{{{{http://www.gstatic.com/m/images/}}}\\{{{logo_large_noshade.gif|Small Google Logo}}}}} | {{http://www.gstatic.com/m/images/logo_large_noshade.gif|Small Google logo}} | | **As Link** | {{{[[http://www.google.com|{{http://www.gstatic.com/}}}\\{{{m/images/logo_large_noshade.gif|Visit Google}}]]}}} | [[http://www.google.com|{{http://www.gstatic.com/m/images/logo_large_noshade.gif|Visit Google}}]] | ===== Tables ===== Table cells have limited markup capability which include text formatting, links, line breaks, and special tags. Each cell content must be on //one line// (Tip: use {{{\\}}} line breaks to force new lines). Table headers are marked by the equal sign ({{{=}}}). | **With Header** | {{{|=Heading 1 |=Heading 2 |}}}\\{{{|Cell 1 |Two\\lines |}}}\\{{{|//Cell 2// |Cell 2 |}}} | <>
Heading 1Heading 2
Cell 1Two
lines
Cell 2Cell 2
<> | **Tip**: Complex tables are better constructed with HTML. So you can just write your table out with HTML tags like {{{}}}, {{{}}}, and {{{
}}}. Then wrap the whole table with the {{{<> ... <>}}} special tag. ===== Miscellaneous ===== | **Horizontal Rule** | {{{----}}} | <>
<> | | **Escape Char** | {{{~#1}}} | #1 | | | {{{~http://example.com/}}} | ~http://example.com/ | The escape character ({{{~}}}) makes any character following it not parsed as wiki markup. This is very useful for not having lists automatically created or having links automatically converted. ==== Advanced ==== ===== Special Tags ===== Special functions are surrounded by {{{<<}}} and {{{>>}}}. Here are a few that you can use: | **Page Title** | {{{<>This is the title<>}}} | //Page title is: This is the title// | **Note**: If **page title** isn't specified, the wiki will look for a header at the top of the wiki document and use that header as the page title. | **Include** | {{{<>}}} | //[[SandBox]] content appears here.// | | **Div** | {{{<
>}}}\\{{{**Your** //Text//}}}\\{{{<
>}}} | //Wraps content in {{{
}}} tags.// | | **Span** | {{{<>}}}\\{{{**Your** //Text//<>}}} | //Wraps content in {{{}}} tags.// | **Note**: The div and span special tags have optional attributes: {{{id}}}, {{{class}}}, and {{{style}}}, which operate similar to the HTML equivalent. Styles are heavily restricted and sanitized. | **HTML** | {{{<>}}}\\{{{ ...
}}}\\{{{<>}}} | //Sanitized HTML appears here.// | **Tip**: While you should try to use wiki markup as much as possible, sometimes it's easier to drop into HTML mode and have finer control over the document. An example would be to use HTML markup to create tables (using {{{}}}, {{{}}}, and {{{
}}} tags). | **Comment** | {{{<>Will not be shown.<>}}} | //Comments are not shown.// |

= Welcome to your new wiki! =

You will want to replace this text with whatever you want to put on your new home page. This is done by **clicking the "edit this page" link** in the bottom right-hand corner. Any time you want to edit this or any content page, just click on the link!

If you are the //administrator// of this wiki, you will see a link at the top of this page where you can access the Wiki Admin. There, you will be able to manage users and fine-tune settings for this wiki (like adding a site title)!

Some pages you might want to check out:
* [[FormattingGuide|Formatting Guide]] - read through the simple syntax used to create and edit pages.
* [[SandBox]] - play around with the syntax here.
